sub_title: Director of Planning | Helping Companies in Empowering Teams Through Emotional Intelligence Development | Health and Safety Leader | 6 Sigma Green Belt
summary:
>Welcome to my profile! With 15+ years of experience as a seasoned manager, and accomplished speaker, marked by an entrepreneurial spirit and problem-solving acumen, I am dedicated to propelling positive transformation. Throughout my career, I've been committed to assisting multinational organizations in overcoming intricate challenges through innovative strategies.

>An essential aspect of my expertise lies in orchestrating the development of novel programs, processes, and training initiatives. My passion extends to crafting engaging team-building activities that foster a culture of unity and employee engagement.

>With an MBA in QHSE, a 6 Sigma Green Belt certification, and fluency in Portuguese, English, and Spanish, I'm also a Certified Adult Trainer, holding qualifications from a reputable US company. My focus on Learning and Development, coupled with expertise in Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment, has enabled me to propel company growth.

>As I drive my career toward Emotional Intelligence (EI), I'm undertaking a dual formation with courses in Emotional Intelligence for Results from a distinguished institution specializing in EQ applied in Neuroscience. Additionally, I am pursuing the CHO-Chief Happiness Officer course - Neuroscience Applied to Happiness. My objective is to forge an effective and distinctive bridge between QHSE and EI, uniting these critical domains.

>As a passionate advocate for Emotional Intelligence and QHSE, I have the privilege of being the host and producer of the 'MindfulQHSE Insights Talks'. In this endeavor, I bring contemporary teachings inspired by science and philosophical insights, along with enlightening conversations with thought leaders. My goal is to inform, inspire, educate, and stimulate our audience about the challenges of the intricacies of the mind and the cauldron of emotions that are part of the human experience.

Hobbies:
>Outside of my professional endeavors, I am an avid traveler with a deep appreciation for exploring different cultures. These international experiences have cultivated an open-minded and adaptable approach to working in multicultural environments, as well as a valuable network of global relationships.

>Passionate, self-taught, and curious about creating and writing, I am the author of a book of poems. Feel free to ask for a copy :) and immerse yourself in the world of words with a touch of lightness and joy.

Send me a message to connect - Mobile: +55 66 992147001 or e-mail: tmbicalho@gmail.com

projects.title: 6 Sigma Project-Alliance for Environmental Preservation, Sustainability and Cost Reduction
projects.description:
- Responsible for the 6 Sigma project to reduce the specific environmental impacts associated with the use of disposable cups and pots. The goal was to increase the use of reusable cups and pots in the Cristal´s stores, making the customers asking their beverages or ice creams in reusable items. This simple gesture reduces sig-nificantly the environmental impacts.

-The project shows that when fully implemented, this policy could save Cristal more than $30 k per year in packaging costs. The in-store reusable pilot test showed that noteworthy environmental and economic benefits could be achieved from even minor changes in store operations. A reusable cup and pots may be used, on average, 1,000 times or more (and is generally designed for 3,000 uses), the environmental benefits of using reusable items in terms of reduced energy use, air and water pollution, and solid waste can be tremendous.

• Project successfully implemented: remains the use of reusable cups and pots.

profile_positions.description:
•	In the first month, I implemented the weekly leadership meeting, enhancing strategic planning, project tracking, and updates, which steered decision-making focus, streamlined processes, and enhanced activity accuracy.
•	Executed the Business Action Plan incorporating quantitative project analysis, detailing developmental and delivery stages through the Action Registry Dynamic Table, complete with structured charts and established KPIs. This framework facilitated activity tracking and decision-making.
•	In the first 3 months, created the company's inaugural Convention, featuring group activities and an Emotional Intelligence workshop, along with a strategic meeting designed to enhance team performance, align objectives, foster cohesion, and advance collective goal attainment. This initiative nurtured critical thinking and promoted sustainable business development.
•	Developed the Sustainability Manual, introducing innovative measures to cultivate an ESG culture and operationalize programs aligned with the United Nations' 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
•	My leadership led to the integration of an annual organizational development planning calendar, defining organizational strategy through activities like SWOT analysis involving the entire corporation.
•	Formulated the company's Job Roles and Functions Manual, providing vital information for diverse human resource practices. This resource defined and clarified responsibilities and expectations intrinsic to each role, revealing communication gaps, redundancies, and responsibility overlaps while identifying task-related shortcomings.
profile_positions.title: Director of Planning And Development

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Customer Service Department, participating in organizational strategic planning, leadership, and support provided to ensure business objectives are met. The PDCA cycle is executed to guarantee excellence and optimum performance while solving problems and managing change.

•	Developed a diverse array of impactful documents, seamlessly integrated into new project deliveries, encompassing operational and maintenance processes, team training and workshops, procedures, standards, and manuals focused on quality, health, and safety. This strengthened the company's brand among clients by enhancing team performance and elevating the quality of delivered developments.
•	Created the company's internal Certificate of Excellence for new projects by crafting a Manual and Audit Program, ensuring sustained adherence to performance metrics and the implementation of annual improvement plans.
•	Designed and developed a new Business Plan that transformed an underutilized space within projects into a new SPA for relaxation and well-being for residents, subsequently evolving into a distinct business within the company. This initiative not only generated additional revenue but also significantly enhanced customer experience, attracting new clients and becoming part of the pilot project for new developments.
•	Implemented QHSE Management Systems in new projects, ensuring alignment with both internal standards and external regulatory agencies.
Formulated and implemented the Emergency Response Plan, which involved creating documentation and conducting team training for each new project.

profile_positions.description:
E&P Offshore Contracts in Latin America
Received the Certificate of Recognition due to my dedication, commitment, and contributions.
Reporting to the QHSE Latin America Manager, appointed to maintain compliance with local laws, international standards, processes, and procedures to 2 main offices in Brazil, 1 Service Center, 1 Parts and Products Warehouse, more than 5 sites in offshore oil & gas platforms, 36 sites in the onshore gas line, 1 main office in Argentina, 1 in Bolivia and 1 in Chile.  Accomplish with the QHSE Management System, ensuring its conformity to all requirements and its continual improvement through monitoring, measuring, and reviewing KPIs in the internal processes. Qualified instructor for QHSE in Portuguese, Spanish, and English, also headed the annual internal audit calendar for Latin America, receiving and conducting 3rd party audits.

Achievements:
•	Received for 3 consecutive years the Merit Award due to the Zero Accidents mark in the district.
•	Addressing and controlling training and presentations. I achieved 100% of employees trained in QHSE and increased more than 70% the quality of the Incident Reports.
•	Standardized the QHSE system into the 3 districts in Latin America, besides Brazil, with strong verbal and written communications by attending to its regulations for both, off and onshore facilities, creating and controlling the quality and safety procedures and documentation.
•	Developed campaigns for accident prevention and support sites in root cause investigation processes.
•	Drafting PPE programs to be compliant with OSHA requirements.
•	Developed and update the ERP in more the 35 sites in Latin America.
•	Obtained Zero Non-Conformities in the Audits for QHSE;
•	Member of the Six Sigma New Service Center Project - analysis and application of the QHSE rules;
•	Headed the Project Travel Risk Analysis: reduced travel time and cost and increased travel safety for engineers during business travel.

volunteer_experiences.description:
As a volunteer in the "Truck Knowing the SDGs" project, I am thrilled to have contributed to such an important initiative that has the power to change the world for the better. The 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) established by the UN are a crucial step towards a more just and sustainable future for all.

These goals cover a wide range of issues, from poverty eradication to gender equality, clean energy, health, education, and more. What's more, they are all interconnected and dependent on one another, making it imperative that we work together to achieve them.

That's why the "Truck Knowing the SDGs" project is so important. It's a historic itinerary that empowers individuals to become the protagonists of the 2030 agenda. Through the project, we can reach communities, cities, and regions with information about the SDGs, promoting awareness and active participation in the quest for a better world.

The project is especially important for reaching those who may not have access to information about the SDGs, and for showing how each of us can contribute to their achievement. It encourages the creation of networks and partnerships so that we can all work together towards a more just and sustainable world.

As a Fiscal Advisor for the "Canindé" Scouting Group, I am part of a dedicated team that serves underprivileged children in the region. The group operates as a non-formal education movement, complementing the efforts of families, schools, and other institutions, with a mission to provide progressive, engaging, and diverse activities. Our focus is on respecting the different stages of development in children, adolescents, and young individuals, fostering active participation in various areas, such as children's rights, patriotism, respect, and citizenship.

In my role as a Fiscal Advisor, I am actively involved in ensuring the group's financial and administrative aspects are effectively managed. By supporting the organization's operations, I contribute to the successful implementation of the scouting program, which ultimately enriches the lives of the children we serve and empowers them to become responsible, engaged, and compassionate members of society.

English Teacher
-Giving English lessons to coworkers
Lead the Project United for Children • collecting food and toys on specific dates to support local orphanages
